paper_title.en: Small subdivisions of simplicial complexes with the metric topology

description.en: D. W. Henderson established the metric topology vertion of J. H. C. Whitehead's Theorem on small subdivisions of simplicial complexes. However, his proof is valid only for locally finite-dimensional simplicial complexes. In this note, we give a complete proof of Henderson's Theorem for arbitrary simplicial complexes.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE MATHEMATICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.en: Simplicial Complexes and Open Subsets of Non-Separable LF-Spaces

description.en: Let F be a non-separable LF-space homeomorphic to the direct sum Sigma(n is an element of N) l(2)(tau(n)), where aleph(0) < tau(1) < tau(2) < ... . It is proved that every open subset U of F is homeomorphic to the product vertical bar K vertical bar x F for some locally finite-dimensional simplicial complex K such that every vertex v is an element of K-(0) has the star St(v, K) with card St(v, K)((0)) < tau = sup tau(n) (and card K-(0) <= tau), and, conversely, if K is such a simplicial complex, then the product vertical bar K vertical bar x F can be embedded in F as an open set, where vertical bar K vertical bar is the polyhedron of K with the metric topology.

publication_name.en: CANADIAN JOURNAL OF MATHEMATICS-JOURNAL CANADIEN DE MATHEMATIQUES

paper_title.en: Simplicial Complexes and Open Subsets of Non-Separable LF-Spaces

description.en: Let F be a non-separable LF-space homeomorphic to the direct sum Sigma(n is an element of N) l(2)(tau(n)), where aleph(0) < tau(1) < tau(2) < ... . It is proved that every open subset U of F is homeomorphic to the product vertical bar K vertical bar x F for some locally finite-dimensional simplicial complex K such that every vertex v is an element of K-(0) has the star St(v, K) with card St(v, K)((0)) < tau = sup tau(n) (and card K-(0) <= tau), and, conversely, if K is such a simplicial complex, then the product vertical bar K vertical bar x F can be embedded in F as an open set, where vertical bar K vertical bar is the polyhedron of K with the metric topology.

publication_name.en: CANADIAN JOURNAL OF MATHEMATICS-JOURNAL CANADIEN DE MATHEMATIQUES

paper_title.en: Topological type of the group of uniform homeomorphisms of the real line

description.en: In this paper, we study the group H(u)(R) of uniform homeomorphisms having the uniform topology together with two subgroups H(infinity)(R) = {h is an element of H(u) (R): lim(vertical bar x vertical bar ->infinity) (h(x) - x) = 0} and H(c)(R), the group of compact support homeomorphisms. We show that the group H(u)(R) is homeomorphic to l(infinity) x 2(N0) and that the triple (H(u)(R)(0). H(infinity)(R). H(c)(R)) is homeomorphic to (l(infinity) x l(2) X l(2), {0} x l(2) x l(2), {0} x l(2) x l(2)(f)), where 2(N0), denotes a discrete space of the cardinality of the continuum, while H(u)(R)(0) is the identity component of H(u)(R) and is the linear hull of the standard orthonormal basis of the separable Hilbert space l(2). We will also discuss the relations among H(u)(R)(0) and some function spaces containing it. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

J. L. Taylor constructed a cell-like map of a compactum X onto the Hilbert cube IN such that X is not cell-like. In this note, we point out a defect in the construction and show how to fix it.

paper_title.en: A Hilbert cube compactification of the function space with the compact-open topology

description.en: Let X be an infinite, locally connected, locally compact separable metrizable space. The space C(X) of real-valued continuous functions defined on X with the compact-open topology is a separable Frechet space, so it is homeomorphic to the psuedo-interior s = (-1, 1)(N) of the Hilbert cube Q = [-1, 1](N). In this paper, generalizing the Sakai-Uehara's result to the non-compact case, we construct a natural compactification (C) over bar (X) of C(X) such that the pair ((C) over bar (X), C(X)) is homeomorphic to (Q, s). In case X has no isolated points, this compactification (C) over bar (X) coincides with the space USCC(F)(X, (R) over bar) of all upper semi-continuous set-valued functions phi : X -> (R) over bar = [-infinity, infinity] such that each phi(x) is a closed interval, where the topology for USCC(F)(X, (R) over bar) is inherited from the Fell hyperspace Cld(F)*(X x (R) over bar) of all closed in X x (R) over bar.

paper_title.en: A Hilbert cube compactification of the function space with the compact-open topology

description.en: Let X be an infinite, locally connected, locally compact separable metrizable space. The space C(X) of real-valued continuous functions defined on X with the compact-open topology is a separable Frechet space, so it is homeomorphic to the psuedo-interior s = (-1, 1)(N) of the Hilbert cube Q = [-1, 1](N). In this paper, generalizing the Sakai-Uehara's result to the non-compact case, we construct a natural compactification (C) over bar (X) of C(X) such that the pair ((C) over bar (X), C(X)) is homeomorphic to (Q, s). In case X has no isolated points, this compactification (C) over bar (X) coincides with the space USCC(F)(X, (R) over bar) of all upper semi-continuous set-valued functions phi : X -> (R) over bar = [-infinity, infinity] such that each phi(x) is a closed interval, where the topology for USCC(F)(X, (R) over bar) is inherited from the Fell hyperspace Cld(F)*(X x (R) over bar) of all closed in X x (R) over bar.

paper_title.en: Classifying homeomorphism groups of infinite graphs

description.en: In this paper, we classify topologically the homeomorphism groups H(Gamma) of infinite graphs Gamma with respect to the compact-open and the Whitney topologies. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Classifying homeomorphism groups of infinite graphs

paper_title.en: Hausdorff hyperspaces of R-m and their dense subspaces

description.en:
Let Bd(H)(R-m) be the hyperspace of nonempty bounded closed subsets of Euclidean space R-m endowed with the Hausdorff metric. It is well known that Bd(H)(R-m) is homeomorphic to the Hilbert cube minus a point. We prove that natural dense subspaces of BdH(R-m) of all nowhere dense closed sets, of all perfect sets, of all Cantor sets and of all Lebesgue measure zero sets are homeomorphic to the Hilbert space l(2). For each 0 <= 1 < m, let
nu(m)(k) = {x=(x(i))(i=1)(m) is an element of R-m : x(i) is an element of R\Q except for at most k many i},
where nu(2k+1)(k) is the k-dimensional Nobeling space and nu(m)(0) = (R\Q)(m). It is also proved that the spaces Bd(H)(nu(1)(0)) and Bd(H)(nu(m)(k)), 0 <= k < m - 1, are homeomorphic to l(2). Moreover, we investigate the hyperspace Cld(H)(R) of all nonempty closed subsets of the real line R with the Hausdorff (infinite-valued) metric. It is shown that a nonseparable component H of CldH(R) is homeomorphic to the Hilbert space l(2) (2(N0)) of weight 2(N0) in case where H (sic) R, [0, infinity), (-infinity, 0].

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE MATHEMATICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
